DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Quality of Life Erection Function Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a scaled set of values rating changes in the ability of the penis to function for hardening, enlarging and rising indicating arousal in males due to interference from symptoms of prostate cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Quality of Life Erection Function
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to changes in the ability of the penis to function for hardening, enlarging and rising indicating arousal in males due to interference from symptoms of prostate cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredDefinition: Erection is the hardening, enlarging and rising of the penis which often occurs in the sexually aroused male.:Function; what something is used for.

Concepts.definition: The hardening, enlarging and rising of the penis which often occurs in the sexually aroused male.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Quality of Life Function Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a scaled set of values rating interference of prostate cancer symptoms with activities of daily living.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of especially low value or worth.

Concepts.definition: Of especially low value or worth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having no exceptional quality or ability._The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems.

Concepts.definition: Having no exceptional quality or ability.
